title: What does AJAX stand for?

options.b: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML

title: Who developed AJAX?

options.b: Google

title: What is the primary purpose of AJAX?

options.a: To create animations in web pages
options.b: To build web applications with a single page
options.c: To enable asynchronous data exchange between the browser and server without full page reloads

title: In AJAX, what method is used to send an HTTP request to the server?

options.b: GET

title: Which object is commonly used to create an instance of an XMLHttpRequest in JavaScript for AJAX requests?

options.b: XMLHttpRequest

title: What is the purpose of the XMLHttpRequest's `open` method in AJAX?

options.a: To close the connection to the server
options.b: To open a new browser window
options.c: To open a connection to the server and specify the HTTP method and URL
options.d: To open a new tab in the browser

title: In AJAX, what event is triggered when an HTTP request is complete?

options.b: onError

title: What is the purpose of the XMLHttpRequest's `send` method in AJAX?

options.a: To send an HTTP request to the server
options.b: To send an email
options.d: To delete data from a database

title: In AJAX, what object is commonly used to parse JSON data received from the server?

options.b: TextDocument

title: What is the purpose of the `onreadystatechange` event in AJAX?

options.b: To handle changes in the readyState property of the XMLHttpRequest object
options.c: To send data to the server

title: What is the HTTP status code for a successful AJAX request?
In AJAX, what does the readyState property of the XMLHttpRequest object indicate when it's equal to 4?

options.b: The request is complete

title: What is the purpose of the `onerror` event in AJAX?

options.b: To handle errors that occur during the HTTP request

title: In AJAX, what is the difference between a synchronous and asynchronous request?

options.a: Synchronous requests block the user interface while waiting for a response, while asynchronous requests do not
options.b: Synchronous requests are faster than asynchronous requests
options.c: Asynchronous requests can only be used for specific data types
options.d: Synchronous requests require a special HTTP header

title: What is the purpose of the same-origin policy in AJAX?

options.a: To allow requests from any origin
options.b: To prevent requests from other origins for security reasons
options.d: To specify the content type of responses

title: What is a common use of AJAX in web applications?

options.b: To build single-page applications

title: In AJAX, what does the `abort` method of the XMLHttpRequest object do?

options.b: It closes the browser window
options.c: It cancels the current HTTP request
options.d: It sends data to the server

title: What is the purpose of the `onload` event in AJAX?

options.b: To handle changes in the readyState property of the XMLHttpRequest object
options.c: To send data to the server
options.d: To handle a successful response from the server

title: In AJAX, what is the responseText property of the XMLHttpRequest object used for?

options.b: To store the server's response data as text
options.c: To send data to the server
options.d: To specify the content type of the response

title: What is the purpose of the `onprogress` event in AJAX?

options.b: To track the progress of a file upload

title: In AJAX, what is the difference between the `GET` and `POST` request methods?

options.a: There is no difference between them
options.b: GET is used to send data to the server, and POST is used to retrieve data from the server
options.c: GET is used for read-only operations, and POST is used for data modification or submission
options.d: GET is more secure than POST

title: What is the purpose of the `timeout` property of the XMLHttpRequest object in AJAX?

options.a: To set the server's response time
options.b: To specify the request's timeout in milliseconds
options.c: To control the browser's rendering time

title: In AJAX, what is the purpose of the `onloadstart` event?

options.b: To display a loading spinner

title: What is the purpose of the `withCredentials` property of the XMLHttpRequest object in AJAX?

options.a: To set the credentials for accessing the server
options.b: To enable or disable cookies in the request
options.c: To send user credentials to the server

title: In AJAX, what is the purpose of the `onloadend` event?

options.a: To display the final result of an operation
options.b: To handle errors

title: What is the purpose of the `onreadystatechange` event in AJAX?

options.b: To handle changes in the readyState property of the XMLHttpRequest object
options.c: To send data to the server
